title: Critical Reasoning
description: Critical Reasoning assesses your ability to analyze arguments, evaluate evidence, identify assumptions, and draw logical conclusions. The questions test skills such as recognizing valid inferences, strengthening or weakening claims, and spotting flaws in reasoning through real-world scenarios and structured logic problems.

questions.question: Scenario: 'If it rains, the ground gets wet. The ground is wet.' Evaluate: What assumption makes this imply it rained?
options: Rain is the only way the ground gets wet
questions.correctAnswer: Rain is the only way the ground gets wet

questions.question: What is an assumption in an argument?
options: An unstated premise needed for the conclusion
questions.correctAnswer: An unstated premise needed for the conclusion

questions.question: Create: What counterexample weakens 'All birds can fly'?
Scenario: 'Students who study hard pass exams. John passed.' What doesn’t follow?
Evaluate: Why might 'If A, then B' not imply 'If B, then A'?
What strengthens 'Eating healthy improves health'?
options: Studies show a link between diet and health
Some people eat junk and are healthy
questions.correctAnswer: Studies show a link between diet and health

questions.question: Scenario: 'All managers are leaders. Some leaders are ineffective.' What can be inferred?
What weakens 'More education reduces crime'?
Evaluate: Why is an assumption critical to an argument?
options: Without it, the conclusion may not hold
questions.correctAnswer: Without it, the conclusion may not hold

questions.question: Create: What assumption supports 'If sales increase, profits rise'?
What can be inferred from 'Some cats are black, all cats are pets'?
Scenario: 'If you exercise, you’ll lose weight.' What weakens this?
What strengthens 'Better roads reduce accidents'?
options: Data shows fewer crashes on improved roads
questions.correctAnswer: Data shows fewer crashes on improved roads

questions.question: Evaluate: Why might an argument fail without evidence?
options: It lacks support for its claims
questions.correctAnswer: It lacks support for its claims

questions.question: Create: What counterexample weakens 'All tall people are athletes'?
options: A tall person who is a writer
questions.correctAnswer: A tall person who is a writer

questions.question: What can be inferred from 'All A are B, some B are C'?
Scenario: 'If the team wins, morale improves.' What assumption is critical?
What weakens 'More police reduce crime'?
Evaluate: Why might an inference be invalid?
options: It goes beyond the given information
questions.correctAnswer: It goes beyond the given information

questions.question: Create: What strengthens 'If it’s sunny, people go outside'?
options: Sunny days correlate with outdoor activity
People stay in on cloudy days
questions.correctAnswer: Sunny days correlate with outdoor activity

questions.question: What can be deduced from 'No fish fly, all birds fly'?
Scenario: 'If sales drop, layoffs occur.' What weakens this?
What assumption supports 'More study time improves grades'?
Evaluate: Why might a counterexample disprove a claim?
options: It shows an exception to a generalization
questions.correctAnswer: It shows an exception to a generalization

questions.question: Create: What weakens 'All software is bug-free after testing'?
What can be inferred from 'Some X are Y, all Y are Z'?
Scenario: 'If profits rise, stock prices increase.' What strengthens this?
options: Data links profits to stock rises
questions.correctAnswer: Data links profits to stock rises

questions.question: What weakens 'Better training improves performance'?
